sentences.sContent: I hope to have some good news for you soon.
sentences.sCn: 我希望很快就能给你好消息。

sentences.sContent: ...the rise of the internet has led to a declining consumption of news from outside the reader's borders...
...What is the news report mainly about...
...What is the problem with many companies according to the news report...
...What does the news report say about the salt miners...
...Father has told all his business friends the good news about the baby...
...The good news is that a combination of sunscreen and covering up can reduce melanoma rates...
...That was news to me--I would need to freed another way to structure my daily existence...
...She reports the current political news for her paper...
...and news radio greatly enlarged their audiences...
...because reporters frequently get news stories just by talking and listening to people...

phrases.pCn: n. 坏消息；令人讨厌的人；倒霉的事
被报导（在新闻报道中出现）
n. 通讯社或政府机构发布的新闻稿（等于press release）

words.tran: 多新闻的；爱闲话的；成话题的
新闻广播员；新闻评论广播员
饶舌者；爱传播新闻的人

trans.tranOther: reports of recent events in the newspapers or on the radio or television
